detaileddescription.para: Frame Assember that can re-assemble IPv4 packets.
Frame Serializer that can serialize IPv4 packets.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t max_packet_size, const GG_Ipv4FrameSerializationIpConfig *ip_config, const GG_Ipv4FrameAssemblerIpMap *ip_map, GG_Ipv4FrameAssembler **assembler)
memberdef.name: GG_Ipv4FrameAssembler_Create

parameterdescription.para: Maximum packet size that can be re-assembled by the frame assembler.
Configuration options used for header compression. If NULL, no compression will be done.
Source/Destination IP address remapping info. If NULL, no remapping will be done.
Pointer to where the new instance will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if an instance was created, or a negative error code.

parameterdescription.para: Object on which this method is called.

detaileddescription.para: Get the GG_FrameAssembler interface for this object.

parameterdescription.para: Object on this this method is called.

simplesect.para: The GG_FrameAssembler interface for this object.

detaileddescription.para: Get the GG_Inspectable interface for this object.

parameterdescription.para: Object on this this method is called.
Configuration options used for header decompression. If NULL, decompression won't be supported.
Pointer to where the new instance will be returned.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if an instance was created, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Get the GG_FrameSerializer interface for this object.

parameterdescription.para: Object on this this method is called.

simplesect.para: The GG_FrameSerializer interface for this object.

parameterdescription.para: Object on which this method is called.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the IPv4 checksum for a buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The data to compute the checksum for.
Number of bytes of data.

detaileddescription.para:
self
The header to serialize.
buffer
The buffer to serialize into. If NULL is passed, no serialization is performed, but the size needed to serialize this header is returned via the buffer_size parameter.
buffer_size
[in,out] Pointer to the size of the buffer (or to a 0 value if buffer is NULL). When the method returns, this value is updated with the number of bytes serialized into the buffer, or the number of bytes needed if the buffer size passed was too small.
compute_checksum
Set to true if the checksum should be computed locally.
NOTE: this method does not fully validate that the fields of the packet header are valid, so the serialized data may not be a valid IPv4 packet header if the input structure was not itself valid.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the header could be serialized or the buffer was NULL, GG_ERROR_NOT_ENOUGH_SPACE if the buffer is too small, or another negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Parse an IPv4 header from its serialized form.

parameterdescription.para: The header whose fields will be set.
A data buffer containing an IPv4 header.
Size of the data buffer.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if a valid header was found and parsed, or a negative error code.

parameterdescription.para: The UDP header to serialize.
The buffer to serialize into. This buffer must be able to hold at least GG_UDP_HEADER_SIZE bytes.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if the header could be serialized, or a negative error code.

detaileddescription.para: Parse a UDP header from its serialized form.

parameterdescription.para: The header whose fields will be set.
A data buffer containing a UDP header.
Size of the data buffer.

simplesect.para: GG_SUCCESS if a valid header was found and parsed, or a negative error code.
